summary: The Servicemember to Veteran Health Care Connection Act of 2025 aims to streamline healthcare access for separating military personnel. It establishes a pre-transition health care registration system, automatically enrolling service members 180 days before separation. The bill mandates outreach to explain enrollment, provide post-separation assistance, and requires the VA to facilitate appointments. It also includes provisions for system establishment, Congressional briefings, coordination with the Department of Defense, reporting, and a focus on a simple, streamlined process for veterans’ healthcare.
